block.title: Slack Alert Action
block.text: Default configuration for the Slack API. (Can be overriden when the alert is configured)

block.title: Slack connection settings
block.text:
http://proxy_user:proxy_pass@proxy_server:proxy_port
proxy_user, proxy_pass and proxy_port are optional
proxy_user and proxy_pass default to empty
proxy_port defaults to the default port for the protocol (80 for http and 443 for https)
In order to obtain the Webhook URL you have to create a new incoming webhook integration for you Slack instance. See Incoming Webhooks Docs for details.
This is the default token that will be used if no token is defined for a specific alert.

block.title: Mandatory settings
block.text: Enter the default fieldname from the search results that contains the alert type. Defaults to field name severity.
Enter the default fieldname from the search results that contains the message. Defaults to field name message.
Enter the default message. If both Message Field and Message are entered, the Message Field is used. If the Message Fiedl does not exist in the search, the Message is used.

block.title: Optional settings
block.text: Can start with # (channel) or @ (person). Prefix defaults to # if omitted. Channel defaults to the channel configured for the webhook you use. If the channel starts with an @, the user will receive the message in the Slackbot channel.

block.title: Alert color settings
block.text: The default alert color (HTML color name, rgb(r,g,b) format or HEX format)
JSON notation for color per severity (HTML color name, rgb(r,g,b) format or HEX fwrmat) For example: { "CRIT": "#FF0000", "WARN": "orange" }
